data.title: Windows Server 2003 End of Life
data.meta_description: Windows Server 2003 End of Life, Windows Server 2003 expires, July 15, July 15th, server migration
data.text:
The countdown has started....

Windows Server 2003/R2 support expires on July 15, 2014. The average server migration can take up to 200 days. Numbers don’t lie – now is the time to migrate. Many are unaware of the dramatic impact Windows Server 2003/R2 End of Life can have on their business.

What does End of Life mean?:

Updates will no longer be developed or released

Increase in costs for maintaining aging hardware

Lack of compliance with standard and regulations

Vulnerability to security threats

Dataprise is offering a free, no-obligation needs assessment to any company currently using Windows Server 2003/R2 in order to assist you with a smooth transition.

For more details on Windows Server 2003/R2 End of Life, download a free, informational document.

Did You Know? 39% of all Microsoft servers run the Server 2003, for which 37 critical updates were released last year. About 9.4 million of the 24 million servers running 2003 are in the U.S.
